e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:40): scribe: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:40): Topic: font-weight
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:41): JD: In Cambridge we discussed bolder and lighter
befddef7b56a6caf71fa21f2235a8111 (01:41): http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/Tracker/issues/61
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:42): JD: It's a frustrating discussion, because of platform restrictions and lack of [cool] fonts
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:43): JD: m+ (Japanese Open Source font) supports seven weights
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:43): JD: 300 is equal to 200, 700 is equal to 600

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:48): JD: the issue in Cambridge was, given a line of text, given font fallback, multiple fonts can be used, then with nested elements with bolder, bolder, bolder, what should happen?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:49): CL: if you have a value already from an inherited context [... scribe missed ...]
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:49): JD: where do you make the determination?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:50): JD: am I simply doing incremental steps of boldness or am I picking a font somehow and resolving the calculation at that point
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:50): JD: of course the computed value comes in because it becomes funny

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:51): DB: computed value can be 1) just a weight, 2) a pair of a weight and a number (number indicates times bolder written), 3) a weight plus a sequence of bolder/lighter steps
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:52): SZ: when I say bolder and there are at least two weights in the font, I'm at the lighter of the two, I'm in a span that has a bolder, what should I expect?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:52): JD: euh, the bolder one
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:52): SZ: it changes the number
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:52): JD: BB proposed that you calculate a number based on the first font
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:53): JD: the reason I brought up m+ is that there a number of gotchas with that
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:53): JD: [missed]
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (01:53): (Chris demonstrates some tests with ZalamanderCaps, a font with six weights)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:53): JD: if I say my body is 400 and I go to bolder
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:54): JD: then you get 500, but then if you have a fallback font that has 400 and 700 you end up with 400 again
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:55): JD: in this world, most fonts are 400/700
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:55): JD: I suggest we simply iterate through 100/400/700/900 for bolder/lighter
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:56): HL: you can still use the absolute values if you really know things
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:56): HL: this is just for the relatives
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:56): CL: good point
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): SZ: there are some 400/600
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): JD: I don't know of those, Japan has some 300/600
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (01:57): not so worried if its just the relatives. As long as higher quality results are not excluded
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): JD: will still do the right thing
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): HL: is the rounding defined?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): JD: yes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): HL: sounds reasonable
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:57): JD: you get a consistent computed value
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (01:58): wights in zalamander:
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:58): SZ: IH's distinction goes away, right?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:58): DB: yes
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:58): DB: this probably addresses the use case for bolder/lighter better and is much simpler
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:58): [humming]
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (01:59): critical difference is that you can do bolder/lighter without knowing the current font family
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:59): JD: I will write this out
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:59): DB: I think you might want to ping DH directly
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (01:59): DB: I think Opera might do that as well

ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (02:08): ... hence Arial and Arial Black, two families on windows and one family on mac
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (02:08): ... thus MS have a "preferred family"  but CSS only allows selecting by slope, width and weight
ac3b293515e969dace7717d9104ad079 (02:09): s/slope/style/

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (02:18): JD: the flipside of this, after the break I want to talk about the specifics of the @font-face mechanism and local faces
